Break Junction and Hold measurement analysis¶

Break Junction Trace Pairs¶

TracePair(trace, load_from[, ...])

Class to represent a break junction trace pair

TracePair.load_trace_pair(bj_file)

Loads the pull-push trace pair defined by TracePair.trace_num from TracePair.file_path.

TracePair.calc_plateau_length([...])

Calculates plateau length in the given range.

TracePair.plot_trace_pair([ax, x_val, ...])

Plot the loaded pull-push trace pair

Break Junction Histograms¶

Histogram(folder[, load_from, traces, ...])

Class for statistical analysis of break junction traces

Histogram.calc_hist_1d()

Calculate 1d conductance histogram based on the parameters provided for the defined Histogram object

Histogram.calc_hist_2d(align_at[, ...])

Calculate 2d conductance-displacement histogram for pull and push traces aligned at the conductance value align_at in the displacement range range_pull and range_push, respectively

Histogram.calc_plateau_length_hist([xrange, ...])

Calculate plateau length histograms

Histogram.calc_temporal_hist()

Calculate single conductance 1d histogram for each included trace, and collect them to create a temporal histogram of the break junction traces

Histogram.calc_stats(align_at[, ...])

Perform all statistical analysis in one iteration

Histogram.calc_corr_hist_2d()

Calculate correlation matrix

Histogram.plot_example_traces(traces, shift)

Plot selected trace(s) traces as example in one plot

Histogram.plot_hist_1d([ax, direction, ...])

Plot 1d conductance histogram, and add annotations

Histogram.plot_hist_2d_both([dpi])

Plot both pull and push 2d conductance-displacement histograms

Histogram.plot_hist_2d_one([direction, ax, dpi])

Plot 2d conductance-displacement histogram for 'pull' or 'push' traces defined by the direction parameter

Histogram.plot_plateau_length_hist([ax, ...])

Plot plateau length histograms

Histogram.plot_temporal_hist([ax, ...])

Plot temporal histograms

Histogram.plot_corr([mode, dpi])

Plot correlation histogram

Histogram.save_histogram(fname)

Saves histogram to h5 file

Histogram.load_histogram(fname)

Load histogram from file fname

Hold Trace Analysis¶

HoldTrace(trace, load_from[, bias_offset, ...])

Class to represent a hold trace pair

HoldTrace.load_hold_traces(hold_file)

Load hold parameters to the corresponding attributes

HoldTrace.plot_hold_traces([direction, ax, ...])

Plot hold traces

HoldTrace.analyse_hold_trace([num_of_fft, ...])

Analysis of steps of a single trace

HoldTrace.area_under_psds(freq, psd_results)

Calculate the areas under PSD curves in the given frequency range

HoldTrace.area_under_single_psd(freq, psd_result)

Calculate the area under a PSD curve in the given frequency range (start, end)

HoldTrace.calc_exponents4psds(freq, psds[, ...])

Calculate exponents for each PSD

HoldTrace.calc_noise_value(areas, bias_steps)

Calculate the noise value from area under each PSD

HoldTrace.calculate_avg_value_on_step(...)

Calculate avg values for each step in the ranges: in_ranges

HoldTrace.calculate_freq_resolution()

Calculates the frequency resolution from the length of the fft intervals

HoldTrace.calculate_psds(psd_intervals)

Calculate the power spectral densities on each bias step

HoldTrace.find_bias_steps(bias[, min_len, ...])

Finds the range of each bias step in the measurement

HoldTrace.find_max_fft_interval(min_step_length)

Calculates the maximal possible length (in points) of a sub-range in a step, that is a power of two and so it is fit to perform fft calculations on

HoldTrace.find_psd_intervals(...)

Find intervals for individual PSD calculations

HoldTrace.find_signal_steps(measured_signal)

Finds the point of each signal step in the measurement

HoldTrace.fit_line_to_psd(freq, psd, fit_range)

Fit a line to a single PSD and return the line parameters

HoldTrace.is_long_enough(trace_array, min_length)

Checks whether the length of a single trace exceeds a certain value min_length

HoldTrace.plot_psds([pull, color_list, ...])

Plot calculated PSDs for each bias step with different color

HoldTrace.remove_thermal_background_1d(...)

Remove thermal background from some_array

HoldTrace.remove_thermal_background_2d(...)

Remove the thermal background by subtracting the first column from all other columns

Noise Analysis¶

NoiseStats(folder[, bias_offset, traces, ...])

Class for noise analysis

NoiseStats.calc_stats(bias_offset[, ...])

Calculate all statistics for the chosen traces

NoiseStats.calc_stats_old(bias_offset[, ...])

Calculate all statistics for the chosen traces

NoiseStats.plot_correlation(n, correlation)

Parameters:

NoiseStats.plot_noise_power_2dhist(...[, ...])

Parameters:

NoiseStats.scat_and_hist(xlabel, ylabel[, ...])

Plot scatterplots and histograms for each axis

NoiseStats.scatterplot(x, y[, ax_xlabel, ...])

Parameters:

NoiseStats.scatterplot_pull_push(x_pull, ...)

Scatterpllot of values x and y, for both directions in one plot
